chunks.text_summary: Python uses indentation to define blocks. Variables are dynamically typed. Common types: int, float, str, bool, list, tuple, dict. Use '#' for comments.
Lists are mutable ordered sequences; tuples are immutable; dicts map keys to values; sets store unique items. Use list comprehensions for concise transformations.
if/elif/else for branching; for loops iterate over iterables; while loops run while condition is true; use 'break'/'continue'; use 'try/except' for error handling.
Define functions with 'def'; arguments can be positional, keyword, *args, **kwargs; return values with 'return'; use docstrings to document behavior.
